meanings.definition: To gather or form into a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: The children conglobate around the teacher during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The snowflakes conglobate to create a snowball.
meanings.sent3: The ants conglobate to discuss their next picnic raid.
meanings.sent4: The stars conglobate in the night sky, forming beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The dough conglobates into a perfect ball for baking.

meanings.sent1: The conglobate berries looked delicious on the bush.
meanings.sent2: The conglobate clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The conglobate pillows on the bed made it extra cozy.
meanings.sent4: The conglobate rocks on the beach were perfect for skipping.
meanings.sent5: The conglobate planets in the solar system amazed the astronomers.
